JobFullDesc: Company DescriptionWe don’t just collect data we connect data. We have the best data and the best tools. We continuously challenge conventional approaches to market research, and we disrupt our industry to ensure that our clients always get the best solutions.YouGov is an international research and data, analytics group.Our mission is to supply a continuous stream of accurate data and insight into what the world thinks so that companies, governments and institutions can better serve the people and communities that sustain them. We have the best data and the best tools. We continuously challenge conventional approaches to research, and we disrupt our industry to ensure that our clients always get the best solutions.This is a unique opportunity to join YouGov and play a key role in our strategic growth plan by building and leading the development of our work with clients from civil society, companies, politics, Governments and other multi-lateral organizations. The successful candidate will take the lead in identifying and cultivating key target clients, improve and expand our research capabilities and elevate YouGov’s brand as a data research service.We are driven by a set of shared values. We are fast, fearless and innovative. We work diligently to get it right. We are guided by accuracy, ethics and proven methodologies. We trust each other and bring these values into everything that we do. Each day, our highly engaged proprietary global panel of over 8 million people provides us with thousands of data points on consumer opinions, attitudes and behaviour. We combine this continuous stream of data with our research expertise to provide insights that enable intelligent decision-making and informed conversations.Our core offering of opinion data is derived from our highly participative panel of 9 million people worldwide, with 33 million interactions and billions of data points. We combine this continuous stream of data with our deep research expertise and broad industry experience into a systematic research and marketing platform. We have 34 offices in 22 countries and panel members in 38 countries. We are fast, fearless, trust each other and care about getting it right. Job DescriptionAs Research Solution Partner at YouGov Civic and Public Data Sector, you excel at identifying and developing global business opportunities through deep knowledge of the political, civic and social challenges, your accounts and a profound ability to build relationships at all levels of the organisation. You are an excellent stakeholder manager – externally as well as internally – and work across all lines of business.What will I be doing?Continuously identifying and developing new opportunities within the key account(s) and leverage the compelling assets of YouGov to identify, build and deploy connected data solutionsYou will be responsible for the delivery of superior connected insights to our high potential accounts by adding value to topline reporting and analysis conducted by the Research and Product team.As Research Solutions Partner, you will be working very closely with the Key Account Managers across the EU, and you will be collaborating in a truly international environment with the Research and Product teams across EU, and creating virtual account teams for deliveryImmerse yourself in our data and identify insights that will inspire and provide genuine value for our clientsEngaging with international sector heads on industry insights, and the Market Science team and DIU on advanced analyticsWhat’s in it for me?This is a strategically important role with a great opportunity to influence our business and grow and develop our high potential accounts.The role also represents a great opportunity for further growth within the EU region or globally within the YouGov Group.QualificationsWhat do I need to bring with me?Demonstrated knowledge and experience in the area of Civic and public data. Being able to demonstrate commercial acumen and political, civic society and NGO research credentials are highly desirable but not essential.Technical skills and qualificationsYou will have experience in managing large scale, complex, international research projects remotelyExperience in operating effectively within a matrix structure – engaging and leading internal resources that are shared across multiple accounts (From Research Team, Product Team and Market Science Team.)You have deep knowledge about market research which will support your quest of providing insights-driven data analysis A desire to develop new ideas and solutions that benefit both YouGov and civil societyExcellent written skills, ability to create process documents, templates, etc.Some, but not extensive business and commercial acumenFluent in English and German. University degree or the equivalent in life experience.Behavioural competenciesStrategic Agility – focuses on the bigger picture, anticipates future consequences and trends accurately; creates competitive and breakthrough strategies and plansExcellent stakeholder management skills, you enjoy working across all seniority levels and lines of business – you will be collaborating with a number of diverse project teams – hence, you would need a great understanding in how to operate and work across cultures and countries.You are accountable and can take ownership of complex tasksConfident decision maker – you may need to make quick decisions under time pressure   Additional InformationCompetitive base salary with a very attractive benefitsVibrant, collaborative team atmosphere A unique service offering to civic clients
